Description: Egyptian(izing) glazed composition (faience) scarab engraved with hieroglyphic designs; mould-made and glazed; two nefer signs with sun discs above flanking a cartouche; nefer symbol with Maat feathers above the cartouche.
Curator's comments: Discussed by P.H. Merrillees in Malmgren (No. 171). The incised hieroglyphic signs are decorative and do not spell out an Egyptian text. The occurence of this Hyksos-period item, along with the imported Tell Yahudiyeh ware vessels, suggest that the settlement was linked to the emerging international commercial networks of the Second Intermediate Period, signs of which are also visible at Arpera and Hala Sultan Tekke .
Bibliographic references: Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 4)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 280)
Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (No. 171, pp. 141-2)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (U.34)
